entries.title: Chile plans to open embassy in occupied Palestinian territories
entries.description: Chilean President Gabriel Boric says move aims to give Palestinians representation and respect under international law.

entries.title: The 10 players who caught our eye at the World Cup
entries.description: From Musiala to Aboubakar to Amrabat, here are the 10 players that impressed us most at this World Cup.

entries.title: Photos: In Madrid, a ‘toy hospital’ marks its last Christmas
entries.description: Antonio Rivas took over the workshop from his father in the 1970s and watched as interest in traditional toys fell.

entries.title: China’s COVID rebellion
entries.description: The protests that exposed cracks in China's middle-class dream

entries.title: Russia dismisses US decision to send Patriot missiles to Ukraine
entries.description: Russia's Vladimir Putin slams US move to send Patriot missiles to Ukraine, saying move won't help resolve conflict.

entries.title: US governor to remove makeshift border wall criticised as ‘stunt’
entries.description: Arizona Governor Doug Ducey has reached an agreement to remove shipping containers stacked as a wall from federal lands.

entries.title: What does future hold for Afghan women after university ban?
entries.description: Women in Afghanistan express shock and anger over Taliban decision that drew international condemnation.

entries.title: FTX founder Bankman-Fried released on $250m bond
entries.description: Bail package requires Bankman-Fried surrender his passport and remain in confinement at his parents' home in Palo Alto.

entries.title: Low weekly jobs claims underscores tight labour market
entries.description: New data shows a still-tight labour market while Q3 economy rebounded to 3.2 percent, revised up from 2.9 percent.

entries.title: US House moves to expand oversight after Trump tax revelations
entries.description: Bill requiring the US tax enforcement agency to audit presidents' tax filings faces uphill battle to become law.

entries.title: US warns Taliban of ‘costs’ over university ban for Afghan women
entries.description: US secretary of state says Taliban is sentencing women and girls in Afghanistan to a 'dark future without opportunity'.

entries.title: Sweden still has requirements to meet to join NATO: Turkey
entries.description: Stockholm is not even halfway through fulfilling the commitments it made to secure Ankara's support, Turkey says.

entries.title: Armed groups in northern Mali pull out of Algiers peace talks
entries.description: The groups negotiating with the military government demand talks in a neutral country under international mediation.

entries.title: What is the post-FTX future of cryptocurrency?
entries.description: Cryptocurrencies, experts say, have mainly been speculative, which only worked as long as real dollars were there.

entries.title: Biden warns Americans to take ‘dangerous’ winter storm seriously
entries.description: The president urges people to heed warnings of local authorities as snow and frigid temperatures move across the US.

entries.title: Key Trump allies refused to answer January 6 panel questions
entries.description: Transcript of interviews with allies of former US president shows that they invoked the Fifth Amendment when questioned.

entries.title: Brazil’s incoming President Lula unveils more cabinet picks
entries.description: Left-wing leader, set to take office on January 1, says his team aims to 'rebuild the country' after Bolsonaro's tenure.

entries.title: Nepal to release serial killer Charles Sobhraj on Friday: Lawyer
entries.description: French serial killer Charles Sobhraj expected to return to France but will not leave prison until Friday, lawyer says.

entries.title: Staying warm this winter: How to beat rising home energy costs
entries.description: Al Jazeera looks at how soaring heating and power costs are affecting millions on the brink of energy poverty.

entries.title: Spain’s legislators approve gender self-identification reforms
entries.description: If passed into law, the reforms would allow those over 16 to change their legally registered gender with greater ease.

entries.title: Former Russian deputy PM wounded by shelling in Donetsk
entries.description: Dmitry Rogozin says he was struck by shrapnel during an attack on a hotel in eastern Ukraine.

entries.title: France, football, colonialism: Take the best, leave the rest
entries.description: The colonial era may have ended, but French extractive policies in its former colonies have not.

entries.title: Europe’s New Moral Crusade: A campaign against progressive values
entries.description: Who is behind a coalition against liberal, progressive values in Europe?

entries.title: Middle East round-up: Only one in 10 vote in Tunisian elections
entries.description: Here’s a round-up of Al Jazeera’s Middle East coverage this week.

entries.title: Ukraine expects key offensive as Russia plans to expand army
entries.description: The war is poised to escalate as Russia has planned new conscription and Ukraine’s allies have lifted weapons bans.

entries.title: Turkey, Saudi Arabia condemn Taliban’s university ban for women
entries.description: Saudi Arabia expressed 'astonishment and regret' over the ban, while Turkey called it 'neither Islamic nor humane'.

entries.title: Greek MEP in EU parliament corruption case protests innocence
entries.description: Eva Kaili asks a Belgian court to release her from detention under electronic surveillance.

entries.title: India begins to randomly test international visitors for COVID
entries.description: Federal health minister announces new rule in parliament, citing an increase in cases in neighbouring China.

entries.title: Russia accuses US of fighting proxy war in Ukraine
entries.description: Kremlin spokesman criticises Zelenskyy's visit to US and military support for Kyiv, says Russia's war goals will be met.

entries.title: Jordan’s truckers struggle to get by, sparking protests, violence
entries.description: The deaths of four police officers highlight the issue of fuel protests, but Jordan's problems are much deeper.

entries.title: Armenia: Russia’s peacekeepers failed mission in Nagorno-Karabakh
entries.description: Yerevan says the troops are not fulfilling an obligation to control the Lachin corridor that it says is being blockaded.

entries.title: Does Trump have anything to fear from his legal troubles?
entries.description: A House committee advised that the former president be charged with defrauding the US - as he runs for the job again.

entries.title: Al-Shabab kills two policemen, one civilian in eastern Kenya
entries.description: The group continues to make cross-border raids to pressure Kenya to withdraw its forces from the AU mission in Somalia.

entries.title: Sysmex says Japan approves blood test kit for Alzheimer’s marker
entries.description: Kit measures accumulation of protein that marks disease - a rare advance in tackling a condition that affects millions.

entries.title: Nigerian central bank raises $225 cash withdrawal limits
entries.description: The bank had recently announced directives to limit the amount of cash in circulation in Africa's largest economy.

entries.title: Fiji’s military called in to maintain order after disputed polls
entries.description: The prime minister, who has refused to concede, said the military was deployed to ensure security.

entries.title: There will be life after Ramaphosa
entries.description: It is time the ANC realises that standing by Ramaphosa is no longer to the benefit of the party or the country.

entries.title: Palestinian footballer killed by Israel in West Bank: Medics
entries.description: Israeli forces shot dead the 23-year-old Palestinian and wounded five others in Nablus during a raid.

entries.title: Ivory Coast battles chocolate companies to improve farmers’ lives
entries.description: Ivory Coast is the world’s top cocoa-producing country but receives just 4% of the $100bn chocolate industry's profits.

entries.title: The good, bad, and the ugly: West Africa’s big issues in 2022
entries.description: A recap of top issues in West Africa in 2022, including heated political campaigns and armed groups gaining ground.

entries.title: Alleged crime boss dubbed ‘Asia’s El Chapo’ arrives in Australia
entries.description: Extradited Chinese-Canadian suspect Tse Chi Lop, 59, said to head up the Asian mega-cartel 'Sam Gor', or 'The Company'.

entries.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 302
entries.description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 302nd day, we take a look at the main developments.

entries.title: WTO rules against US in Hong Kong labelling dispute
entries.description: Three-person panel finds US-China tensions do not justify unfavourable treatment of the financial hub.

entries.title: Zelenskyy invokes World War II, says ‘no compromises’ with Russia
entries.description: Ukraine's president said US military assistance to Kyiv was an 'investment' in security and democracy for the world.

entries.title: FTX founder Bankman-Fried’s colleagues plead guilty to fraud
entries.description: Gary Wang and Caroline Ellison have agreed to cooperate with the authorities, according to US prosecutors.

entries.title: UN Security Council resolution demands end to Myanmar violence
entries.description: The only other Security Council resolution on Myanmar was in 1948, which recommended then-Burma's entry to world body.

entries.title: What role will ‘Religious Zionism’ have in the next Israeli govt?
entries.description: Religious Zionism is a growing force in Israel, and will have a strong presence in the next Israeli government.

entries.title: Israel’s Netanyahu says deal agreed with far-right to form gov’t
entries.description: Benjamin Netanyahu's agreement sees him return to power as head of the most right-wing coalition in Israel's history.
